streams

Class AbstractStream<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • streams.AbstractStream<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<E>, Stream<E>

    public abstract class AbstractStream<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stream<E>
    Abstract class which provides a skeleton implementation of Stream. Clients inheriting from this class only need to implement the Iterable#iterator.
    Version:
    0.1.3
    Author:
    hugo benichi
    See Also:
    Stream

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public abstract java.util.Iterator<E> iterator()
        Clients implement this. Follows the usual Iterator contract.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<E>

      • map

        public <F> Stream<F> map(Function<? super E,? extends F> transform)
        Creates a new stream by delegating calls to an underlying iterator taken from the current stream. Function#call is invoked in Iterator#next.
        Specified by:
        map in interface Stream<E>
        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the output Stream.
        Parameters:
        transform - a Function object which specifies how the objects provided by this stream should be transformed. Returns null if transform is null.
        Returns:
        a new Stream of possibly a different type.
        See Also:
        Stream.map(streams.Function<? super E, ? extends F>), Function

      • fold

        public <F> Function<F,F> fold(Operator<F,E> folder)
        Creates an anonymous Function instance which wraps a call to Stream#fold_with_map. In turn, Stream#fold_with_map calls a closure which wraps the Operator folding operation obtained from the caller. This allows to use Stream#map to perform the computation.
        Specified by:
        fold in interface Stream<E>
        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the output scalar value. May be different from E.
        Parameters:
        folder - a Operator object to compute the folded scalar value. Returns null if folder is null.
        Returns:
        Function object which when its call() method is invoked returns the result of the reduce operation. The input argument to call() is the initial value of the fold operation. The result is not buffered and further invocations of call() will rerun the computation.
        See Also:
        Streams.fold_with_map(streams.Stream<E>, streams.Function<? super E, F>), Operator

      • reduce

        public Function<?,E> reduce(Operator<E,E> reducer)
        Creates an anonymous Function instance which wraps a call to Stream#fold_with_map. In turn, Stream#fold_with_map calls a closure which wraps the Operator reducing operation obtained from the caller. This allows to use Stream#map to perform the computation.
        Specified by:
        reduce in interface Stream<E>
        Parameters:
        reducer - a Operator object to compute the reduced scalar value. Returns null if folder is null.
        Returns:
        a Function object which when its call() method is invoked returns the result of the reduce operation. The Function object takes any value as input and can be called with null. The result is not buffered and further invocations of call() will rerun the computation.
        See Also:
        Streams.fold_with_map(streams.Stream<E>, streams.Function<? super E, F>), Operator

      • select

        public Stream<E> select(Predicate<? super E> check)
        TODO: DOCME!
        Specified by:
        select in interface Stream<E>
        Parameters:
        check - a Predicate object which specifies which test to run.
        Returns:
        a new Stream object of the same type.
        See Also:
        Predicate
